item.title: Your Name Might Shape Your Face, Researchers Say
item.description: February 27, 2017 - Do you look like a Joy? Genes and culture may make it more likely that names and faces align. But researchers say people also may adjust their expressions to match social expectations of their name.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 27, 2017 - Do you look like a Joy? Genes and culture may make it more likely that names and faces align. But researchers say people also may adjust their expressions to match social expectations of their name. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/27/517496915/your-name-might-shape-your-face-researchers-say

item.title: Models Are Still Pressured To Be Ultra-Thin, Survey Says
item.description: February 27, 2017 - A majority of models say they're threatened with job loss if they don't shed pounds. Researchers worry this contributes to poor body image and might increase eating disorders among teenage girls.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 27, 2017 - A majority of models say they're threatened with job loss if they don't shed pounds. Researchers worry this contributes to poor body image and might increase eating disorders among teenage girls. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/27/517458922/models-are-still-pressured-to-be-ultra-thin-survey-says

item.title: A Medicine That Blunts The Buzz Of Alcohol Can Help Drinkers Cut Back
item.description: February 27, 2017 - Naltrexone was approved to treat alcohol disorders more than 20 years ago. But many doctors still don't know that when combined with counseling it can help people resist the urge to drink too much.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 27, 2017 - Naltrexone was approved to treat alcohol disorders more than 20 years ago. But many doctors still don't know that when combined with counseling it can help people resist the urge to drink too much. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/27/516890375/a-medicine-that-blunts-the-buzz-of-alcohol-can-help-drinkers-cut-back

item.title: The Call-In: The Opioid Epidemic And How Opioids Have Affected Your Lives
item.description: February 26, 2017 - The opioid epidemic is growing. Lulu Garcia-Navarro speaks with Jim Barnum, whose brother died after an opioid addiction and Chuck Rosenberg, acting administrator of the DEA.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 26, 2017 - The opioid epidemic is growing. Lulu Garcia-Navarro speaks with Jim Barnum, whose brother died after an opioid addiction and Chuck Rosenberg, acting administrator of the DEA. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/26/517305305/the-call-in-the-opioid-epidemic-and-how-opioids-have-affected-your-lives

item.title: Dentists Work To Ease Patients' Pain With Fewer Opioids
item.description: February 26, 2017 - After minor surgeries, many dentists used to reflexively prescribe quick-acting opioids to relieve a patient's pain. Now they're learning to counsel patients about better, less addictive alternatives.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 26, 2017 - After minor surgeries, many dentists used to reflexively prescribe quick-acting opioids to relieve a patient's pain. Now they're learning to counsel patients about better, less addictive alternatives. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/26/513865623/dentists-work-to-ease-patients-pain-with-fewer-opioids

item.title: Doctor Takes Death Education To High School Classrooms
item.description: February 25, 2017 - NPR's Michel Martin talks with Dr. Jessica Zitter about preparing high-school students to deal with end-of-life care. Zitter is a critical care and palliative medical doctor in Oakland, Calif.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 25, 2017 - NPR's Michel Martin talks with Dr. Jessica Zitter about preparing high-school students to deal with end-of-life care. Zitter is a critical care and palliative medical doctor in Oakland, Calif. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/25/517262420/doctor-takes-death-education-to-high-school-classrooms

item.title: Lucille Horn, Who Was Nursed To Health In A Coney Island Sideshow, Dies At 96
item.description: February 25, 2017 - At a time when incubators were rejected by most doctors, Martin Couney treated Horn with one at a sideshow of premature infants. She died earlier this month, 96 years after most experts expected.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 25, 2017 - At a time when incubators were rejected by most doctors, Martin Couney treated Horn with one at a sideshow of premature infants. She died earlier this month, 96 years after most experts expected. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/02/25/517221933/lucille-horn-who-was-nursed-to-health-in-a-coney-island-sideshow-dies-at-96

item.title: A Taste For Pork Helped A Deadly Virus Jump To Humans
item.description: February 25, 2017 - People were dropping dead in Malaysia, and no one could figure out why their brains were swelling. A young scientist solved the mystery. Then he had to get people to believe him.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 25, 2017 - People were dropping dead in Malaysia, and no one could figure out why their brains were swelling. A young scientist solved the mystery. Then he had to get people to believe him. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/02/25/515258818/a-taste-for-pork-helped-a-deadly-virus-jump-to-humans

item.title: When You Love An Old Dog, Managing Care Can Be A Challenge
item.description: February 25, 2017 - Aging dogs often need extra medical care. But there comes a time to be realistic about what can and can't be done, veterinarians say. The pet's comfort is paramount.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 25, 2017 - Aging dogs often need extra medical care. But there comes a time to be realistic about what can and can't be done, veterinarians say. The pet's comfort is paramount. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/25/515610795/when-you-love-an-old-dog-managing-care-can-be-a-challenge

item.title: GOP Health Bill Draft Would Cut Medicaid, Emphasize Tax Credits
item.description: February 24, 2017 - The plan would replace insurance subsidies for low-income families with tax credits for everyone, eliminate the requirement to buy health care, and end taxes on medical devices.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 24, 2017 - The plan would replace insurance subsidies for low-income families with tax credits for everyone, eliminate the requirement to buy health care, and end taxes on medical devices. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/24/517074764/gop-health-bill-draft-would-cut-medicaid-emphasize-tax-credits

item.title: Advice From Patients On A Study's Design Makes For Better Science
item.description: February 24, 2017 - Increasingly, advocates for patients are in the room when big medical studies are designed. They demand answers to big questions: "Will the results of this study actually help anybody?"
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 24, 2017 - Increasingly, advocates for patients are in the room when big medical studies are designed. They demand answers to big questions: "Will the results of this study actually help anybody?" http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/24/515226648/advice-from-patients-on-a-studys-design-makes-for-better-science

item.title: Environmental Groups Say California's Climate Program Has Not Helped Them
item.description: February 24, 2017 - California's signature climate plan is under attack from environmental justice groups. Some say the cap-and-trade program hasn't done anything to clean up the air in low-income communities.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 24, 2017 - California's signature climate plan is under attack from environmental justice groups. Some say the cap-and-trade program hasn't done anything to clean up the air in low-income communities. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/24/515379885/environmental-groups-say-californias-climate-program-has-not-helped-them

item.title: Kevin Jones: Can Embracing Uncertainty Lead To Better Medicine?
item.description: February 24, 2017 - Sometimes, doctors just don't have the answers. Surgeon Kevin Jones says having the humility to acknowledge this leads to better medicine.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 24, 2017 - Sometimes, doctors just don't have the answers. Surgeon Kevin Jones says having the humility to acknowledge this leads to better medicine. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/24/516710048/kevin-jones-can-embracing-uncertainty-lead-to-better-medicine

item.title: Indiana's Claims About Its Medicaid Experiment Don't All Check Out
item.description: February 24, 2017 - Indiana's health program for low-income people is experimental, and needs federal approval to continue. The state says its program is working, but some claims lack much-needed context.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 24, 2017 - Indiana's health program for low-income people is experimental, and needs federal approval to continue. The state says its program is working, but some claims lack much-needed context. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/24/516704082/indiana-s-claims-about-its-medicaid-program-dont-all-check-out

item.title: White House Spokesman Predicts More Federal Action Against Marijuana
item.description: February 23, 2017 - Press secretary Sean Spicer's comments on Thursday came as a poll indicated a majority of Americans support legalizing marijuana.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 23, 2017 - Press secretary Sean Spicer's comments on Thursday came as a poll indicated a majority of Americans support legalizing marijuana. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/02/23/516945294/white-house-spokesman-predicts-more-federal-action-against-marijuana
